TV Review: Agents of SHIELD - Series 3 Episode 7: 'Chaos Theory'

With a villain so poorly developed that it deserves to be compared to the terrible Spider-Man 3, this episode of Agents of SHIELD was probably as bad as the show's awful first series, says Thomas Ron

TV Review: Agents of SHIELD - Series 3 Episode 6: 'Among Us Hide...'

With a pointless character death and a highly artificial plot point wedged in to it, this episode of Agents of SHIELD is the worst one in the series so far, says Thomas Ron

TV Review: The Apprentice - Series 11

Liam Dooley takes a look at this year's series of The Apprentice after Joseph Valente was revealed as the candidate who is to become Lord Alan Sugar's new business partner

TV Review: Agents of SHIELD - Series 3 Episode 5: '4,722 Hours'

Simmons' time on the alien planet makes for one of the best episodes of Agents of SHIELD, says Thomas Ron

TV Review: Doctor Who - Series 9 Christmas Special: 'The Husbands of River Song'

This year's Christmas special of Doctor Who is surprisingly much better than Niall Whitehead anticipated, it's a Christmas miracle!

A tough decision gives Hunter the chance to take centre stage for once in another decent episode of Agents of SHIELD, says Thomas Ron

Review: Sunset Song

This adaption of the Lewis Grassic Gibbon novel of the same name has incredible cinematography but a lacking plot, says Angel Lloyd

TV Review: American Horror Story: Hotel - Episode 10: 'She Gets Revenge'

Despite lasting all of 25 seconds, this recent episode of American Horror Story's ending has to be the best scene of the entire season says Lauren McNeilage

TV Review: Agents of SHIELD - Series 3 Episode 3: 'A Wanted (Inhu)man'

Aside from an unconvincing romance, this episode of Agents of SHIELD utilizes its characters perfectly, says Thomas Ron

Rhys Thompson selects 10 highlights from the Christmas TV Schedules

Review: Black Mass

Laura Hancock praises Black Mass which may lack complexity, but boasts a solid narrative structure and a host of great performances

TV Review: Agents of SHIELD - Series 3 Episode 2: 'Purpose in the Machine'

The third series of Marvel's Agent of SHIELD is not quite living up to expectation, but at least it is not as bad as series one, says Thomas Ron

Review: Brooklyn

Brooklyn is special for many reasons, but principally for the chance to watch the maturation of Saoirse Ronan, says Andrew Kendall

Review: Krampus

Krampus has a lot of fun moments, but Lauren McNeilage finds it doesn't do much justice to its source material

TV Review: Doctor Who - Series 9 Episode 12: 'Hell Bent'

The series finale of Doctor Who sees the Doctor returning to his home planet with one goal in mind: reviving Clara. Niall Whitehead reviews

TV Review: American Horror Story: Hotel - Episode 9: 'She Wants Revenge'

Lauren McNeilage weighs on the latest episode of AHS: Hotel, which is a chaotic but enjoyable romp

TV Review: American Horror Story: Hotel - Episode 8: 'The Ten Commandments Killer'

Lauren McNeilage takes a look at the latest episode where we are finally given the identity of the Ten Commandments Killer... (it's exactly who everybody thought it would be)

Review: Carol

Carol is an intense, slow-burning romance that will linger on the tip of cinema's tongue, says Laura Hancock

Where exactly is Doctor Who headed?

Luke Rix-Standing takes a look at where the new series of Doctor Who has taken the show and gets a little nostalgic for the 'good old days' of Christopher Eccleston and David Tennant

TV Review: The Walking Dead - Series 6 Episode 8: 'Start to Finish'

This mid-series finale is not the best one in the show's history but it does have some exciting moments, says Liam Dooley

Review: Sicario

Andrew Kendall praises Sicario, Denis Villeneuve's distillation of drug-war tensions between lawbreakers and law enforces

The Rocky Horror Picture Show: Forty Years Later

Jack Richardson takes a look at The Rocky Horror Picture Show's legacy and relevance forty years after its debut

TV Review: The Walking Dead - Series 6 Episode 7: 'Heads Up'

This week sees the much anticipated reveal of a series regular's fate and the continuation of conflict inside the walls of Alexandria, says Liam Dooley

TV Review: Agents of SHIELD - Series 3 Episode 1: 'Laws of Nature'

Thomas Ron hopes that Agent of Shield's third season can stay on the right track and not return to its season one issues

TV Review: The Walking Dead - Series 6 Episode 6: 'Always Accountable'

After a two week slump, The Walking Dead is back on top form, says Liam Dooley

TV Review: American Horror Story: Hotel - Episode 7: 'Flicker'

With movie-star threesomes, Old-Hollywood flashbacks, and a semi-interesting John Lowe storyline, 'Flicker' is a lot of fun - and yet it feels like too little, too late says Lauren McNeilage

TV Review: Doctor Who - Series 9 Episode 9: 'Sleep No More'

Sometimes when Doctor Who releases an experimental episode it is one of the best things on television, but unfortunately that isn't the case with this week's episode, says Niall Whitehead

TV Review: American Horror Story: Hotel - Episode 6: 'Room 33'

Despite a couple of interesting twists, 'Room 33' makes it painfully clear that this season has no plot, says Lauren McNeilage

TV Review: The Walking Dead - Series 6 Episode 5: 'Now'

A sub-par filler episode of The Walking Dead leaves a lot to be desired. Liam Dooley reviews

TV Review: Lewis - Series 9 Episode 6: 'What Lies Tangled' Part Two

Lewis and Hathaway take their final bow and thus end the story of the man who has been described as the nicest copper on TV. Katy Sandalls reviews.
